title: About
text: About this site

title: marium bakes (and cooks)
text:
Hi, thanks for visiting! I am a self-proclaimed baking enthusiast who has been learning how to cook since moving away from home in 2018.
Some of my recipes are from the internet; others have been passed down from family and friends!

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
text:
1 cup unsalted butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
2 eggs
3 cups a.p. flour
1 tsp vanilla essence
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
1 + 1/2 cups chocolate chips

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
text:
1 cup unsalted butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
2 eggs
3 cups a.p. flour
1 tsp vanilla essence
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
1 + 1/2 cups chocolate chips

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
text:
Directions
Mix melted butter, sugars, vanilla and eggs in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, salt and baking soda.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet; combine to form a dough.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Scoop about 1.5 tbsp of the dough and arrange on baking tray 2 inches apart.
Bake 9-11 mins in a 180°C preheated oven.

title: Dalgona Coffee (South Asian Whipped Coffee)
text:
2 tsp instant coffee
2 tsp caster sugar
about 1/4 cup water (enough to dissolve the above)
milk
ice cubes

title: Dalgona Coffee (South Asian Whipped Coffee)
text:
2 tsp instant coffee
2 tsp caster sugar
about 1/4 cup water (enough to dissolve the above)
milk
ice cubes

title: Dalgona Coffee (South Asian Whipped Coffee)
text:
Directions
Heat up water (~ 20 sec in microwave).
Add sugar and coffee, and stir to dissolve.
Beat with electric whip, until foamy.
Add in milk to top of mug.
Add ice cubes to taste.

title: 5-minute Microwave Mug Brownie
text:
3 tbsp brown sugar
3 tbsp a.p. flour
1 + 1/2 tbsp cocoa powder
pinch of salt
3 tbsp milk
1 + 1/2 tbsp cooking oil
dash of vanilla essence
1/4 cup chocolate chips

title: 5-minute Microwave Mug Brownie
text:
3 tbsp brown sugar
3 tbsp a.p. flour
1 + 1/2 tbsp cocoa powder
pinch of salt
3 tbsp milk
1 + 1/2 tbsp cooking oil
dash of vanilla essence
1/4 cup chocolate chips

title: 5-minute Microwave Mug Brownie
text:
Directions
In a microwave safe mug, add in all the dry ingredients and mix.
Add the wet ingredients and combine.
Stir in the chocolate chips, sprinkling 1 tsp of them on top.
Microwave for 45-60 seconds. I like it to be gooey so I prefer 45 seconds.
Serve with vanilla ice cream if available!

title: Vanilla Simple Syrup
text:
2 cups water
1 + 1/2 cups granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
3 tsp vanilla essence

title: Vanilla Simple Syrup
text:
2 cups water
1 + 1/2 cups granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
3 tsp vanilla essence

title: Vanilla Simple Syrup
text:
Directions
In a saucepan on medium-high heat, stir everything other than the vanilla.
Boil until all the sugar has dissolved, about 5 mins.
Remove from the heat and mix in the vanilla essence.
After cooling, transfer to a glass jar and store in fridge.

title: Chocolate Fudge
text:
1 can (400g) sweetened condensed milk
1/4 cup melted butter
3 ounces cocoa powder
about 2 + 1/2 half-rolls (~35 biscuits) Marie Biscuits 1

title: Chocolate Fudge
text:
1 can (400g) sweetened condensed milk
1/4 cup melted butter
3 ounces cocoa powder
about 2 + 1/2 half-rolls (~35 biscuits) Marie Biscuits 1

title: Chocolate Fudge
text:
Directions
Break the biscuits into bite-sized pieces in a medium bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix the melted butter with the cocoa powder.
Once combined, fold in the sweetened condensed milk until smooth.
Add the biscuits and mix until all pieces are coated.
Transfer to a greased/lined dish and freeze until set (> 4 hours).
Eat plain or with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce.

title: Chocolate Fudge
text:
Footnotes


What is a Marie Biscuit? Learn more here ↩︎

title: Fudgy Brownies
text:
1 + 1/2 cup castor (or powdered) sugar
3/4 cup a.p. flour
3/4 cup cooking oil
1/2 cup cocoa powder
1 + 1/2 tsp vanilla essence
3 eggs
1/4 + 1/8 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt

title: Fudgy Brownies
text:
1 + 1/2 cup castor (or powdered) sugar
3/4 cup a.p. flour
3/4 cup cooking oil
1/2 cup cocoa powder
1 + 1/2 tsp vanilla essence
3 eggs
1/4 + 1/8 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt

title: Fudgy Brownies
text:
Directions
Mix sugar, oil, vanilla and eggs in a bowl.
In a seperate bowl mix cocoa powder, baking powder, salt and flour.
Add dry ingredients to wet and mix together.
Pour into a greased/lined pan.
Bake for 20-25 mins in a 180°C preheated oven.

title: Qeema
text:
1 lb ground beef
1 small onion (diced)
2 small tomatoes (diced)
1 tsp ginger paste
1 tsp garlic paste
1/2 tsp salt
2 tsp cumin powder
2 tsp coriander powder
1/2 tsp turmeric powder
1 tsp red chili powder (also known as tez laal masala)

title: Qeema
text:
1 lb ground beef
1 small onion (diced)
2 small tomatoes (diced)
1 tsp ginger paste
1 tsp garlic paste
1/2 tsp salt
2 tsp cumin powder
2 tsp coriander powder
1/2 tsp turmeric powder
1 tsp red chili powder (also known as tez laal masala)

title: Qeema
text:
Directions
Fry the onion until transparent, add tomatoes and cook till soft. Liquidize and set aside.
In a different pan, add the ginger and garlic paste to a little bit of oil till aromatic (1 min or so), add ground beef and cook 80% of the way through.
Add the spices and the onion/tomato paste, and let cook. Add water as needed to make it dry or saucy.
Simmer for 15-20 mins, and you’re done!
